str2: Crispus, ruler of the synagogue at Corinth, converted and baptized by Paul. Of Latin origin; 'crisp'; Crispus, a Corinthian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Corinthian, of Corinth. From Korinthos; a Corinthian, i.e. Inhabitant of Corinth.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
